title: Microsoft Windows 7 "E" Editions - x86-x64 - Collectio
description:
A little something for the ISO Collectors out there. All Windows 7 "E" Editions in two small files that will give you almost 50GB of Windows 7 "E" iso's. The only Prerequisite is having the two original non-SP1 ISO's of Windows 7 Ultimate.

What is Windows 7 Ã¢â‚¬Å“EÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ Edition? They do not have Internet Explorer in them. MS Dropped these in 2009 and decided not to release them.
More info:  <a href="
http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9136168/Microsoft_kills_Windows_7E_puts_IE_back_in_upcoming_OS" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9136168/Microsoft_kills_Windows_7E_puts_IE_back_in_upcoming_OS</a>

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Before you start. You MUST HAVE these two files to get all (x86 and x64) of the Windows 7 "E" editions from these Smartversion files. 

64 BIT 
FILE: EN_WINDOWS_7_ULTIMATE_X64_DVD_X15-65922.ISO
SHA1: 326327CC2FF9F05379F5058C41BE6BC5E004BAA7
===================================================
32 BIT
FILE: EN_WINDOWS_7_ULTIMATE_X86_DVD_X15-65921.ISO
SHA1: 5395DC4B38F7BDB1E005FF414DEEDFDB16DBF610


If you have the above two files, but they are named differently, you will need to rename the files to be exactly as above. Name and SHA1 must be identical (not case sensitive) for this to work. You can use HashCheck (Hashcheckinstall-2.1.11.exe) to check the hashes of your iso's, or download from http://code.kliu.org/hashcheck/ 

Once installed, simply right click an iso, choose properties and you will have a new tab called "Checksums". It will calculate the SHA1 of your ISO.

Unpack the smartvs30_win_x64.zip or smarvs30_win_x86.zip for the system architecture you plan to use to extract Windows 7 E editions.
1) Place all svf files and your ISOÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s in the same folder for easy access.
2) Execute smartv.exe
3) Open either (one at a time):
	EN_WINDOWS_7_ULTIMATE_X64_DVD_X15-65922_to_allWin7x64_E.svf 
	Or 
	EN_WINDOWS_7_ULTIMATE_X86_DVD_X15-65921_to_allWin7x86_E.svf
4) If SmartVersion asks for an iso, point it to the corresponding iso to match the svf you opened.
5) Once the file is loaded, you will see a list of files, simply right click each and extract.

Depending on your system spec's, this can take a few minutes to several minutes for each file. If the program says "Not Responding" let it go, it is working.

Do this for both SVF files until you have all Windows 7 E editions. Almost 50GB of ISO's
